00014 #ifndef VMIMESSAGES_H_
00015 #define VMIMESSAGES_H_
00016 
00017 #include "hostapi/impTypes.h"
00018 #include <stdarg.h>
00019 
00020 
00021 
00022 //
00023 // VMI Message interface - access to simulator stdout and logging
00024 //
00025 
00026 //
00027 // vmiMessage  - writes to stdout and log-file
00028 //
00029 // Arguments:
00030 //    severity: is a string who 1st character is I, T, W, E, F, or A
00031 //              I (info) T (trace) W (warning) E (user error)
00032 //              F (fatal user error) A (internal error)
00033 //              note that F & A cause the program to exit.
00034 //
00035 //    ident:    is either 0 or a string (of 5 or 6 characters) uniquely
00036 //              identifying the messages
00037 //
00038 //    fmt, ...: printf style format string and arguments
00039 //
00040 void vmiMessage(const char *severity, const char *ident, const char *fmt, ...)
00041      __attribute__(( format (printf, 3,4)));
00042 
00043 void vmiVMessage(const char *severity, const char *ident, const char *fmt, va_list ap);
00044 
00045 //
00046 // vmiPrintf - write to stdout and log-file
00047 //
00048 // Arguments:
00049 //    fmt, ...: printf style format string and arguments
00050 //
00051 void vmiPrintf(const char *fmt, ...)
00052      __attribute__((format (printf, 1,2)));
00053 
00054 void vmiVPrintf(const char *fmt, va_list ap);
00055 
00056 
00057 //
00058 // non-returning version of vmiMessage with a severity of "A"
00059 // for use when there's an internal error with no recovery.
00060 //
00061 void vmiAbort(const char *ident, const char *fmt, ...)
00062      __attribute__((format (printf, 2,3), noreturn));
00063 
00064 
00065 //
00066 // VMI_CPU_DBG - Utility macro for debug messages using processor
00067 //
00068 // Useful macro for controlling debug messages generated by a processor model.
00069 // Define CPU_DEBUG_FLAG to identify which bits in the processor flags should
00070 // cause debug messages to be generated.
00071 //
00072 #define VMI_CPU_DBG(_PROC, _M, _FMT, ...)                               \
00073     do {                                                                \
00074         if (vmirtProcessorFlags(_PROC) & CPU_DEBUG_FLAG)                \
00075             vmiMessage("I", _M, _FMT,  ## __VA_ARGS__);                 \
00076     } while (0)
00077 
00078 
00079 //
00080 // VMI_ABORT - Utility macro for aborts
00081 //
00082 // Useful macro for code aborts. Define CPU_PREFIX to a string identifying
00083 // the model.
00084 //
00085 #define VMI_ABORT(_FMT, ...)                                            \
00086     /* LCOV_EXCL_LINE */ vmiAbort(                                      \
00087             CPU_PREFIX "ABRT", "%s:%d:%s " _FMT,                        \
00088             __FILE__, __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, ## __VA_ARGS__ )          \
00089 
00090 //
00091 // VMI_ASSERT - Utility macro for asserts
00092 //
00093 // Useful macro for asserts. Define CPU_PREFIX to a string identifying
00094 // the model.
00095 //
00096 #define VMI_ASSERT(_COND, _FMT, ...)                                    \
00097     do {                                                                \
00098         if (!(_COND)) {                                                 \
00099             /* LCOV_EXCL_LINE */ vmiAbort(CPU_PREFIX                    \
00100             "ASRT", "%s:%d:%s " _FMT,                                   \
00101             __FILE__, __LINE__, __FUNCTION__, ## __VA_ARGS__ );         \
00102         }                                                               \
00103     } while (0)
00104 
00105 
00106 #endif /*VMIMESSAGES_H_*/
